reviews.text: First of all, I cannot believe that anyone would give this property a ONE based on the fact that it 'is not a 5 star hotel'. By doing this you are unfairy skewing traveller opinions. Sure, there are 5 stars down the road from this place (which is more like a 4 star, but a very good 4 star), but they cost up to three times as much! This hotel is beautiful, and historical. The fact that it is so old may be why some consider it a tad rough around the edges, but you can see the amount of care that is put into maintaining such an old property. It is not as easy as maintaining a minimalist boutique.
reviews.title: Beautiful Experience

reviews.text: The views were breathtaking. The rooms were a little dated, but this is definitely reflected in the cost! They were clean and the bathrooms were very new. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. There were options for any dietary needs and the coffee was fresh and tasty. The breakfast room was gorgeous and full of the old world charm that is reflected throughout this hotel.
reviews.title: Old hotel with character with breathtaking views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room felt like I was staying at my Grandma's house, which is good and bad. Room was cozy and very big and had a great view out all 3 windows. The furniture and carpet very old though. You could feel the springs through the mattress and the tv was old and oddly placed where you couldn't use the remote from the right side of the bed. The key to the room weighs like two pounds and is very bulky to carry around(encountered similar in other Swiss hotels). The bathroom is nice but poorly arranged as you have to sit on an angle to use the toilet due to heater in bathroom. But fresh robes and slippers are a nice touch. Location is a big plus, walking distance to the train station for anyone in any kind of shape, and if you can't make it there's a free shuttle. It's also close to dining and entertainment in Interlaken. Thr free breakfast was nicer than most hotel buffets. Many coffees are available made to order including expressos, lattes, cappuccinos, etc. Eggs are also made any way you want. The staff was awesome in informing us about Jungfrau train schedules, help finding our hotel in Thun, and recommending Laterne( a restaurant well off the tourist path in Interlaken. We kept joking that the hallways to the rooms looked like the ones in the movie The Shining and the outside looked like a haunted mansion, but they're both very nice. The lobby is also very grand in decor. For anyone wanting to stay in Interlaken I'd highly recommend this hotel, however if like most your just there to visit the Jungfrau I'd recommend staying in Wengen, Murren, or Grindlewald. All my grips with this hotel were just minor to me and are expressed just to give you an idea of what to expect.
reviews.title: Beautiful room with a view

reviews.text: Delightful looking hotel. Very comfortable bedroom and modern bathroom. Excellent breakfast in lovely room, in better weather, breakfast can be eaten on the patio which is wonderful. Helpful and fairly friendly reception staff. Great location, very close to Interlaken West station (3 minute walk). On arrival at the station with suitcases, we called the hotel and were picked up and driven to the hotel. Interlaken West is at the quieter end of Interlaken and makes a welcome break from the busy, hustle and bustle of Interlaken Ost. There are plenty of local restaurants. Great trips to do from Interlaken West. I would say the best rooms are at the front of the hotel opposite the mountains. Side rooms might be a bit noisy due to the railway running along side nearby. This is a 5 star hotel but really I would classify this hotel as a good 4 star. An enjoyable stay. Recommend going on the boat trip from Interlaken to Thun and a trip to the Jungfraujoch (only in better weather).
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.text: I needed hotel very close to the Interlaken Ost station (which is where the trains up to Lauterbrunnen and then Jungfraujoch (3454 meters) leave from). After seeing 2 other hotels with less stars, the Lindner had the best price (274 CHF for a single). And I got a mountain and river view room, very quiet. Room a bit small but quite OK. Had all I needed. I did not eat there and had no time for breakfast, but had a great dinner in my room from a take-away between station and hotel (3 minutes walk), there is a cheap Italian and a Chinese restaurant there to take-away.
